item.title: Neat little text thingy :)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

	fancyText(new String[] {"I r leet", "wewt!", "hax plocks" });

What ever is in "" will be logged in a new line. Try this as an example:

	fancyText(new String[] {"line 1", "line 2", "line 3" });

item.title: Neat little text thingy :)
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Here is a little thing for putting your text it. If you want it to stand out, use this!
You can input as many Strings as you want, so it's all good 

import java.io.*;
public class TextStudy
{
	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		run();
	}
    public static long run()
{
	fancyText(new String[] {"I r leet", "wewt!", "hax plocks" });
	return -1;
}

public static void fancyText(String[] text)
{
	log("*********************\n");
	String out = "";
	for (int words = 0; words < text.length; words++)
	{
		out += "\t"+text[words]+"\n";
	}
	log(out);
	log("*********************\n");
}

private static void log(String x)
{
	System.out.println(x);
}
}

I want to be able to stick boolean and integer datatypes in there, but I don't see that happening without messing it all up ;/

Read full topic
